project.name: Space Between 10th Anniversary Special
project.description: 10 years of publishing indie comics! This oversized one-shot features new Destiny, NY; Wild Wisps; Afterglow; and more stories!

creator.name: Pat Shand
creator.biography:
SPACE BETWEEN ENTERTAINMENT is a Long Island-based publisher and entertainment studio known for producing comics, graphic novels, and more.

Our new Shopify store launches soon. Check our website!

titre: Destiny, NY TCG Artist Edition card by Leirix (Silver Foil)
ARTWORK PREVIEW of Space Between 10th Anniversary Special
ADD ON 10 YEARS OF SPACE BETWEEN ENT TITLES
HOW TEAM SPACE BETWEEN SHIPS COMICS
texte: Welcome to YEAR TEN!
Pat Shand and his company, Space Between Entertainment, have been using Kickstarter to create and release high-quality comics for ten years now.
Back in 2016, we launched and funded our first campaign: Destiny, NY Volume One.

Since then, Space Between Entertainment has gone on to launch, fund, and fulfill over 100 Kickstarters. This company has become a family, and we're so proud to have Kickstarter backers as part of that.
After ten years of publishing independent comics, we are thrilled to celebrate this special anniversary with you.

Space Between Entertainment 10th Anniversary One-Shot is a 48-page special featuring new stories from some of our most successful titles as well as a special section of new artwork. These stories include...

Meet Logan McBride, who had a prophecy made about her when she was young. She completed her prophecy when she was just thirteen, and now she's in her thirties trying to figure out life after destiny. That brings her to her mysterious girlfriend, Lilith Aberdine, the last surviving daughter of a mystical crime family. The shadow of Lilith's past haunts her, and now she has taken control of her family's empire.

This standalone story tells a new tale in the world of Destiny, NY, which began our journey on Kickstarter back in 2016. This story takes place before Volume One, showing a part of Logan's life we've never seen before.
Creatures, fantasy, & myth! Kingdoms clash in a world where magical creatures serve as companions to warriors & their secret ambitions.

In this prequel story, we meet Hylol and his original guardian Luxx before their fateful battle in Wild Wisps #1. Here, Hylol is a runt who is saved from execution by Luxx, a man who was destined to be a warrior but ran away to become a farmer. Now, Luxx finds himself at odds with the owner of the farmstead, the sociopathic Zadysta.

100 years ago, an event called The Glowing ended the world as we know it, leaving the survivors with an Earth that has been changed. Water is radioactive, animals have mutated, and the world has been painted with beautiful, dangerous, glowing colors. Most of the remaining society has broken into villages in an attempt to rebuild the world they lost, but an adventurous girl named Lacey and her giant cat After have embraced this wild new world in all of its deadly beauty.
This story returns to the world of Afterglow, bridging our two series: Afterglow and Vixx the Hunter.

To celebrate our 10th Anniversary, we are using the comics medium to tell the story of how Space Between Entertainment came to be! The exact same team that brought you the horror/comedy version in I Summoned Cthulhu returns to set the story straight and tell you exactly how we did it.
In addition to the four feature stories, we will also have a gallery of one-page stories/pin-up pages from our other series, including...
Our covers feature characters from our various titles by fan-favorite artists, spotlighting Destiny, NY; Wild Wisps; Afterglow; Private Dance; and more.

Our standard cover is a wraparound tribute to Team Space Between, showing the team creating characters like Logan, Tonkarex, Sabby, & Death Goddess of Cthulhu and getting packages sent to our loyal Kickstarter backers.
This variant cover features Logan from Destiny, NY.
This variant cover features Trinity from Destiny, NY & Gangster Ass Barista.
This variant cover features After & Lacey from Afterglow.
This variant cover features Luxx & Hylol from Wild Wisps.
This variant cover features Sabby from Private Dance.
This variant cover features Sabby from Private Dance.
This variant cover features the original pencils from Cover F printed on matte.

Throughout 2026, Space Between Entertainment and Cheeky Comics will produce collectible challenge coins for our 10th Anniversary. You can collect coins through Kickstarter for every quarter of the year! Challenge Coin: Quarter 1, featuring Sabby from Private Dance, will be featured on many of our campaigns during Quarter 1.
This is the FIRST TIME that this Challenge Coin is available!
Also, look out for special Challenge Coins that will be exclusive to certain Kickstarters or events coming soon!
Final design may slightly differ as we work with our coin provider.

There are two ways to get our sleekly designed 10th Anniversary Collection Box. You can get it through the SBE 10 BOX: Ultimate Collection reward tier with all of the new items from this campaign, including...
Or, you can get the box by itself as an Add-On marked SBE 10 COLLECTION BOX - BOX ONLY.
You can find these convention exclusives of Wild Wisps and Destiny, NY in the Add-On menu, set to the price they were originally sold at during the convention.
70 available.
30 available.
15 available.
15 available.

Get the DOUBLE-SIZED Space Between 10th Anniversary Special with all of the covers available through this Kickstarter at a discounted price. This includes Covers A - G, the Artist Edition, and the Metal Cover.
Get the Ultimate Space Between 10th Anniversary collection. The box contains...

Pat Shand and his company, Space Between Entertainment, have been using Kickstarter to create and release high-quality comics since 2016. You can find many of these through this campaign, separated by genre.
Fantasy
Destiny, NY is where it all began. It is a world like ours, but magic is real and commonplace. Destiny, NY titles available through this campaign include...
Meet Logan McBride, who had a prophecy made about her when she was young.
She completed her prophecy when she was just thirteen, and now she's in her thirties trying to figure out life after destiny.

That brings her to her mysterious girlfriend, Lilith Aberdine, the last surviving daughter of a mystical crime family. The shadow of Lilith's past haunts her, and now she has taken control of her family's empire.
Life and fate pulled Logan and Lilith together... and then apart. Now, Logan must confront the truth of the Aberdine family history as Lilith finds herself on the run from a deadly enemy.
GANGSTER ASS BARISTA is a graphic novel about Trinity Klein, one of Destiny, NY's fan-favorite supporting characters, who is trying to get out of a life of crime by selling coffee.
However, as customers begin to piss her off, it's just like the old saying. Just when she thought she was out...
Wild Wisps is a world of epic fantasy where kingdoms clash and magical monsters serve as companions to warriors & their secret ambitions. The Wild Wisps Universe includes...
WILD WISPS is an ongoing, epic fantasy comic book series for adults about a world that humans share with incredible creatures known as Wisps.
Wisps are magical monsters with elemental powers that can be either commonplace or god-like.
We follow a would-be knight, KINO and his Wisp TONKAREX. When we meet them, these two have lost everything. Their family, their purpose, and their hope. All they have left is each other.
All they have left is a plan: to join QUEEN RAINA'S Guard. However, they harbor a secret that could tilt the balance of Raina's 20-Year War if it gets discovered.

Kino knows the truth about a MYTHIC WISP: a special kind of Wisp born out of one million hatches that has an incredibly rare Tri-Element ability, which gives this extraordinary Wisp the power to alter reality itself.
In the wrong hands, Kino's secret could lead to the end of existence as they know it.
DRAGON GUARDIAN ELODEA #1

Dragon Guardian Elodea is the first issue of an epic fantasy series set in the world of Wild Wisps. The people of Cryberry Cove say that when the sea witch Elodea was a little girl, she would see visions of horrible things... and then, they'd come true.

Fearful of her deadly prophecy, the venom-addicted lord of Cryberry Cove, Sova Lugatsen, sent Elodea away on a ship. Right before Elodea was to be put to death, the ship was attacked by a Glauticus, a powerful and lethal sea serpent. Everyone on the ship was killed, except Elodea, who sank to the bottom. She came face-to-face with the Glauticus and it sensed the power of her magic... and bonded with her.

Now, Elodea lives apart from the human world, in an island sanctuary of Wisps. She has dedicated her life to saving voiceless Wisps, taking on the role of their protector alongside her draconic beasts.
Elodea is once more called back to Cryberry Cove... but is it for vengeance or salvation?
Afterglow is a post-apocalyptic world where a mysterious radioactive event has mutated animals and destroyed the human population. The Afterglow Universe includes...

100 years ago, an event called The Glowing ended the world as we know it, leaving the survivors with an Earth that has been changed. Water is radioactive, animals have mutated, and the world has been painted with beautiful, dangerous, glowing colors.

Most of the remaining society has broken into villages in an attempt to rebuild the world they lost, but an adventurous girl named Lacey and her giant cat After have embraced this wild new world in all of its deadly beauty.

When Lacey discovers her late mother’s journal foretelling another apocalyptic event, she and After embark on a daring journey to save what's left of their world.  Join us on a beautiful journey through this tale of love, loss, and very large cats.
A hunter and her giant radioactive fox set out to survive in a post-apocalyptic world! Will Vixx, a lone hunter, and her companion Kitt, a giant four-eyed fox, be able to make it on their own?
Also features a bonus story featuring Hemlock, a mysterious woman whose body is controlled by a parasitic fungus.
A thrilling series of graphic novels filled with romance and danger, secrets and spells, and a group of witches who are not to be messed with.

Cameron Rivers has spent her entire life believing that she is possessed by a demon. The mysterious presence within her manifests as a little girl made of blue flames…and when she appears, nothing can quell her fiery rage. Now, after a violent incident leads to Cam’s arrest, she meets a coven of witches in prison that will open her eyes to a world of magic and mayhem.

CLONSTERS is a two-volume graphic novel series that combines the weirdness and humor of 90s cartoons like "Aaahh! Real Monsters" with the whimsy and heart of modern-day animation like "Adventure Time."
It follows Polly, a creature called an Earth Nugget, as she goes on an amazing adventure to find her lost splat. Perfect for all ages.
Horror
This 156-page hardcover collects the entire I SUMMONED CTHULHU TO FUND MY KICKSTARTER series with extras!
What if the trends that comic book creators follow to help sell their books were actually Dark Gods?
Would you pledge your soul to the Waifu Goddess, who lures NSFW fans in with cheeky covers?
Or would you fall into the traps of the eerily similar Death Goddess, who has fans of 90s comics in the palm of her hand?
Or would you pledge to the dark god Cthulhu, who has horror fans wrapped around his tentacles?

In this hilarious parody of the comics industry, follow writer Pat Shand as he makes a pledge to a powerful deity in exchange for success… and ends up causing the apocalypse at a comic book convention!
Spooky Girls is an anthology featuring four unique and monstrous tales of friendship, secrets, and self-discovery.
TARANTULA TWINS follows two spider sisters who are pulled apart by different cliques at their monster high school.
PUNK TEEN DEMON QUEEN just wants to go to see her favorite band's farewell tour, but there’s one problem...She’s supposed to take over the world!
JENNY THE WERECAT just wants to work at her cat café and keep her furry little problem a secret, but a new werecat in town has different plans for her.
Lastly, VICKY SLIME is a dead girl reanimated by her mad scientist father, who harbors a dark secret that will turn Vicky’s unlife upside-down.
Each story brings heart, humor, and monstrous charm, making Spooky Girls a must-read for fans of quirky, character-driven tales.

Emmy is a vampire. She has been alive for centuries. Well, not so much alive. But, you know…around. She tried the whole brooding, epic vampire lifestyle. She’s lived countless lives, lost countless loves. She’s done everything there is to do. Now, she lives a life of comfort and boredom, hanging with her pet monster Fletcher and eating cheese fries covered in blood. Vampire poutine, essentially. She's in an eternal funk…until she meets the new sanitation worker.
Emmy falls for the woman she only knows as “Garbage Girl,” who has a secret that would shock even Emmy.
The graphic novel includes two feature stories and bonus tales!
After a hit gone wrong, New York mobster Rocco Davino's soul is under siege by demonic, animalistic spirits.

Rocco has worked his way up in the ranks of the mob, but in 2024, the Italian mafia is a shadow of its former glory. With cell phones and new technology, the world has become one big wiretap. Keeping his actions secret and avoiding rats has become nearly impossible. Even Manny DiBella, Rocco's childhood best friend, has now become an informant.

Recently divorced and trying to redefine his life, Rocco discovers Manny has relocated. He seeks his old buddy out for revenge, but instead discovers that Manny's family has sought protection from something dark and strange.

Rocco escapes the terrifying and disorienting encounter with his life, but finds himself hunted and controlled by demonic spirits that appear to him as hyenas. As Rocco desperately attempts to keep his own crimes secret, these spirits begin to use him as their puppets for acts that chill even this mobster's blood.
Rocco has already sold his soul, but now it's truly in the devil's hands.
Spicy
Private Dance takes you into a New York strip club as we meet the dancers, customers, and bouncers, discovering that there is more to the fantasy than meets the eye.
At work, they create a fantasy for customers that you have to see to believe. However, when we take a closer look, there is a world of stories to explore in the real lives of these dancers.
We follow Sabby as she navigates life in and out of the club, exploring a romance with her customer, a comedian named Nick, whose wife has fallen for another dancer.
Cheeky is made up of five sexy stories that come together for a tantalizing and hilarious climax at the end. Funny, emotional, character-driven, and spicy.

lmagine a device that, when held by a couple, makes music as they touch… lmagine an outing at the beach that leads to a surprising love connection… lmagine a fan fic writer attempting to appease her long-distance girlfriend with steamy stories… and more!
The follow-up to Cheeky!

Imagine a couples retreat at a hotel that starts wild and gets steamier as the weekend goes on.  Imagine a couple that must get creative when a chaotic day leads to a bed that has disappeared.  Imagine a ride sharing service with an app that can read the customer's deepest desires.  Imagine a sheltered man thrown into the world of online dating after coming out of a years-long relationship.  Imagine a trio of workers in a hotel, finding spicy adventures in the accommodations.
This is the final campaign that will offer stickers for Space Between Sticker Club 2025.
For this campaign, we will be giving anyone who missed out on Space Between Sticker Club 2025 a chance to catch up! We will be giving two Space Between Sticker Club Stickers with this campaign.

Founded in 2016 by Pat Shand, Space Between Entertainment has quickly grown into a top independent comic book publisher dedicated to crafting character-driven stories across diverse genres, focusing on unique worlds and compelling narratives for a global audience.

project.name: Playstation Anthology: The Tetralogy
project.verifiedIdentity: DEMOLY Jean Marc DEMOLY Jean Marc
project.description: 100% dedicated to the PlayStation: Exclusive Box Set, 4 Books, 1300+ pages..

creator.name: Geeks-Line
creator.biography: Geeks-Line has already published Nintendo 64, PlayStation 2, Super Nintendo, PC Engine TG-16, NES And Game Boy Anthologies.

texte: Over 30 years ago the PlayStation 1 forever changed the world of video games. As the first mainstream 3D console — a machine of endless possibilities — it left a lasting mark on an entire generation of players, creators, and dreamers of virtual worlds.

Born from that very passion, the PlayStation Anthology tetralogy stands as an exhaustive, well-documented, and heartfelt tribute to the history of a console that transformed not only the video game industry but also the way it is perceived.
This limited & numbered 4-volume box set edition of over 1,300 pages includes:
This first 460-page volume is a reissue of the PlayStation Anthology – Collector’s Edition, originally published in 2018. It includes 6 Chapters, including:

How did we get here? How could a company as experienced and pragmatic as Sony allow itself to be drawn into such a risky venture? Neither mockery nor criticism was enough to stop it. On June 24, 1992, the former president of Sony Corporation, Norio Ohga, took the subsidiary’s future into his own hands. Without any internal consensus, he gave Ken Kutaragi full freedom to pursue his “precious little project.” The bewilderment of Ohga's staff did nothing to dissuade him. Sony was to enter the great race of video games, standing alongside the established giants of the industry, despite having no experience in the field and facing already fierce competition.

It was a decision that would have enormous consequences and ultimately shape the course of video game history. Ohga’s choice remains one of the boldest moves Sony ever made. And in many ways, it reflects a way of thinking that can be traced back through Sony’s history, all the way to its origins. This chapter includes:

Thirty years now separate us from the very first commercial release of the PlayStation. Far from any mercantile or commercial considerations, these three decades have allowed hearts to open, voices to loosen, and memories to resurface. Under such conditions, it becomes not only interesting, but truly exhilarating, for anyone passionate about the subject to speak with the people who, in one way or another, contributed to what would become the greatest success in the entire industry. Across the four corners of the world, we went to meet twenty-six of these individuals who, through their creativity, their emotion, their determination — in short, through their passion — helped shape a part of our lives: our lives as players.

The PlayStation’s swift rise to glory was possible due to its rich game library; supported by the unparalleled capabilities of its hardware. The shockwave it created at launch brought together some of the most talented creators, developers, animators, graphic designers, and musicians, all rallying behind the Sony cause. The Hardware chapter includes:

A trailblazer through and through, the PlayStation 1 set its own trends in gameplay, technology, and even gamer mentality. One particular movement it helped fuel was that of collecting, which expanded dramatically with the rise of 32-bit consoles. In the early 1990s, the West had not yet warmed up to the idea, especially in Europe. There was little available beyond a few Super Nintendo and Mega Drive/Genesis bundles that included a peripheral with the game. Collecting remained the domain of a niche group of connoisseurs. Publishers were therefore unwilling to take risks with such ambitious products, which would have further increased the already high price of their games. It was Sony — the outsider — to step in before publishers began taking these kinds of initiatives, and before video games as a whole would finally gain the support and recognition of a broader, more open audience. This 70-page chapter includes more than 250 special editions sorted by year, and every PlayStation 1 limited edition.

Every console has had its fair share of unreleased and cancelled titles: some highly anticipated, others completely forgettable. With the commercial success of the PlayStation 1 across the globe — over one hundred million units sold — the environment for developers and publishers around the year 2000 was such that even some truly terrible games still managed to reach the market. However, due to financial instability and issues related to exploitation rights, more than a hundred titles were developed and produced only to be abandoned before launch day. In this chapter of the PlayStation Anthology, it feels only fitting that we take a moment to acknowledge the games that fell through the cracks.

A definitive reference work, the PlayStation Collector’s Guide meticulously lists every title released for Sony’s console across all regions. Designed for both dedicated collectors and enthusiasts of video game history, it stands as an essential resource for understanding, cataloging, and preserving this unique legacy.

Note: If you already own the PlayStation Anthology – Collector’s Edition, purchasing this first volume is not necessary. Your existing copy fits perfectly into the Collector’s Box Set alongside the three other volumes (reward: PS Anthology Vol.2, 3, 4 + Box Set)

Spanning more than 750 pages and covering over 4,130 unique titles, these two volumes immerse the reader in the remarkable diversity of the PlayStation catalog — from little-known RPGs and legendary shoot’em ups to cult curiosities and regional exclusives. Together, they form a genuine map of the global PlayStation industry.

The collection compiles reviews of every officially released PlayStation game in Japan, North America, and Europe between 1994 and 2006. Each entry lists the alternative titles used across regions (for example, Bust-A-Move ’99 in North America, retitled Bust-A-Move 3 DX in PAL territories and Puzzle Bobble 3 DX in Japan), along with the publisher, developer, number of CDs, and release dates for each of the three markets. Titles are organized by year, with each section introduced by an analytical overview that highlights the trends and evolution of the PlayStation market over time.

A symbol of an entire generation, the PlayStation 1 made history not only through its games but also through the distinctive visual identity of its cover art. This fourth volume aims to highlight the graphic contrasts between the Japanese, American, and European editions.

From one continent to another, the image representing the same game could change dramatically: a poetic illustration in Japan might become an explosive action scene in the United States, while Europe often struck a balance between the two. These variations reflect the aesthetic, cultural, and marketing choices unique to each market, telling in their own way the global story of the PlayStation.

Together, they form a gallery of visual interpretations — a reflection of a time when cover art played a decisive role in how a game was perceived. More than just a catalog, this fourth volume stands as both a visual archive and a work of memory, celebrating the boundless creativity of Sony’s first console and the diversity of the imaginations it inspired.
Through these covers, an entire facet of PlayStation culture emerges: a dialogue between art, marketing, and video games; a testament to an era when every box, every image, told a story.
Specifications of all Volumes:

Printing: High-quality 4-color process on 135 gsm gloss-coated paper
Trim size: 8.5 × 10.5 in (216 × 267 mm)
Cover: 4-color process with Pantone detailing, matte lamination, and spot gloss UV varnish for enhanced contrast
Paper cover: High-density gloss-coated stock for superior finish
Binding: Premium hardcover, thread-sewn with 2 mm thick cardboard, head and tail bands, and protective shrink-wrap
Weight: 8kg, 17 lb.

NB:
Chapters and pagination are subject to change according to production requirements. A heading may be interchanged from one volume to another.
Release date: Fourth Quarter 2026

Note: 
Those books are not authorized or endorsed by Sony. All registered trademarks, game art, and game screenshots used are the property of their respective holders, subject to copyright, and are utilized here under fair use.

options.name: Genesis / Mega Drive Anth. Ultimate Ed.
options.desc:
Important!

• Receive the Genesis / Mega Drive Anthology – Ultimate Edition early.
• This add-on is only available for the United States, the European Union, and the United Kingdom.

   Presented in its collector slipcase, this limited edition includes the exclusive Box Art Collection volume and stands as the most accomplished work ever dedicated to the Genesis / Mega Drive universe. Conceived as a true collector’s item, each Genesis / Mega Drive Anthology – Ultimate Edition copy is individually numbered.

   Genesis / Mega Drive Anthology – Ultimate Edition will be released in summer 2026, several months ahead of the PlayStation Anthology: The Tetralogy, expected in December.

   This add-on allows you to receive Genesis / Mega Drive Anthology as soon as it ships, without having to wait for the combined delivery associated with the reward “PS Anth. Box Set + GEN/MD Anth. Ult. Ed.”.

project.name: Searching for Don the Beachcomber
project.description: The extraordinary life of the godfather of Tiki culture and the inventor of the Tiki bar.

creator.name: Korero Press
creator.biography:
Korero Press is an independent publisher dedicated to visual culture. We seek out distinctive artists and untold stories—in comic art, illustration, design, and pop culture—producing authoritative books that are made to be collected and treasured.

For news of new releases, events, and offers we recommend you sign up for our newsletter and follow us on social media.

texte: For the first time, experience the untold story of Donn Beach, the founder of Tiki pop culture, through his personal archives.

Donn Beach, born Ernest Raymond Gantt, was the visionary creator of the world’s first tiki bar and the legendary rum cocktail culture that thrives today. Starting modestly in a tiny Hollywood speakeasy during Prohibition, he crafted complex, flavourful drinks like the Zombie and Navy Grog. By combining fresh juices, secret ingredients, and theatrical presentation, Donn invented the very ritual of tropical escapism. His innovations transcended cocktails, shaping themed dining and immersive environments that brought an idealised Polynesian culture to an America captivated by exoticism. He collaborated closely with Filipino bartenders and a supportive circle of friends to expand his empire to Chicago and, later, Hawaii’s Waikiki.

Behind this empire lay a life of authentic cinematic adventure. Born in a tiny west Texas town, he circled the globe twice before he was twenty during the 1920s. He would later become a host and friend to the elite of Hollywood’s Golden Age. His early years as a bootlegger entangled him with the mob, from whose grasp he would struggle for years to break free. Answering the call of duty in World War II, he earned both a Purple Heart for his wounds and a Bronze Star for his exceptional service to airmen—and to figures like Churchill and Eisenhower. He gained and lost fortunes, repeatedly reinventing himself by launching ventures around the globe so iconic they have become the stuff of legend.

Despite personal and business upheavals—including a challenging divorce and rumoured mob alliances—Donn remained the charismatic host and cultural ambassador of his own creation until his death in 1989. His ambitious projects stood as testaments to his vision. Today, his influence endures worldwide in tiki bars, craft cocktail revivals, and the continued celebration of island-inspired hospitality.

Author and historian Tim “Swanky” Glazner has been granted exclusive access to Donn Beach’s personal archives—including never-before-seen photographs, business memos, personal letters, ephemera, and cocktail recipes.
This definitive, 208-page hardback volume will:

“Donn Beach single-handedly invented the Tiki bar and the Tiki drink, but his legacy dimmed over the years because unlike Trader Vic he never published his recipes or his autobiography. This book rights that wrong with heretofore unseen gems from Beach's personal archive, from photographs to business memos to personal letters. A must for every Tikiphile's reference library.” — Jeff “Beachbum” Berry

“Although Donn Beach conceived one of the most successful ‘tropical escapism’ brands in 20th-century hospitality, the man behind this romantic persona remained an enigma—surrounded by rumors as closely guarded as the recipes for his iconic cocktails. Donn’s own life was as extraordinary as any fiction, and it is finally revealed in detail within this fascinating, long-awaited book.” — Sven Kirsten,  The Book of Tiki

“This tome is the closest we’ll ever get to sitting down with the man who created the escapist pop culture phenomenon known as 'Tiki'. Get to know that man, Donn Beach, the man that gave us tropical escapism, filled with rummy cocktails and flotsam and jetsam, still enjoyed today. So pull up a barstool, feast your eyes on some tasty eye candy, and read the story of the real man who created 'Tiki' out of the darkness of Prohibition.” — Marie King, Beverage Director, Don the Beachcomber

Kickstarter provides a unique opportunity to thank our supporters by adding stretch goals to our campaign. The more successful the campaign, the more we can enhance the book for all backers. We hope you will enjoy them, and we very much hope that you will help us to unlock them all!
🔓 Stretch Goal 7K+ Unlocked
🔓 Stretch Goal 10K+ Unlocked
🔓 Stretch Goal 15K+ Unlocked

Tim “Swanky” Glazner is a renowned Tiki culture authority. He is the author of Mai‑Kai: History & Mystery of the Iconic Tiki Restaurant, co‑founder of The Hukilau event, and the official Mai‑Kai historian. His other roles include associate producer of the Donn Beach documentary, creator of the Grogalizer cocktail app, and a producer of Tiki mugs. Based in Knoxville, his home bar – the Hapa Haole Hideaway – showcases his passion for Polynesian pop art and mid‑century artifacts.
During the pledge manager phase, you'll have the opportunity to add these exclusive items to your order.

1. Donn’s Mascot Cannibal
Own a piece of tiki history: a limited-edition mug inspired by Donn’s legendary mascot cannibal.

As Donn circled the globe in the 1920s, he discovered a set of three "cannibal" carvings in Bora Bora. He brought them home, where they became the signature of his Cannibal Bar in Chicago. The trio stood behind the bar and were incorporated into the carved support posts.

A large version of one of these cannibals was created exclusively for Donn.
That special carving first appears after the war in 1946 at his Encino home. When he pulled up stakes and moved to Hawaii to start over, the “mascot” cannibal traveled with him.

There are exactly seven known photos of this carving. Six of them exist only in Donn’s personal archive, virtually unknown until now. Though the original carving has vanished, its spirit lives on in this faithful mug recreation by Eekum Bookum. The mug is currently in production and should be ready to ship in early April.

Raise a Beachcomber cocktail in this rare vessel and toast Donn’s enduring legacy. Standing 8.5 inches tall with a bold 6-inch diameter, this mug commands attention. Our Kickstarter version is strictly limited to 100 mugs.
2. Donn Beach Art Print Set: A set of three high-quality art prints featuring Donn Beach, suitable for framing.

3. Expand Your Tiki Library
Three essential books for your Tiki collection.

The Home Bar Guide to Tropical Cocktails by Kelly ‘Hiphipahula’ Reilly and ‘Trader’ Tom Morgan. The legendary guide to suburbia’s hidden tiki temples, featuring over 150 cocktail recipes. This book is your passport to becoming a master of tropical mixology, perfect for any home bar enthusiast looking to bring paradise into their glass.

Mai-Kai: History & Mystery of the Iconic Tiki Restaurant by Tim "Swanky" Glazner. Dive deep into the story of the legendary Mai-Kai restaurant, the crown jewel of Polynesian Pop. From its founding and mid-century glory to its modern-day preservation, this essential history is filled with stunning archival photography and the lore that made The Mai-Kai a national treasure.

The Lore of the LuWOW is a fun-filled pictorial frolic through the history of the legendary Australian tiki bar The LuWOW and its predecessors, Devilles Pad and the Hula Bula Bar. Packed with cocktail recipes, delightfully chaotic bar decor tips, and visual mayhem, this book captures the wild, irreverent spirit of Down Under tiki.
Shipping costs are not included in your pledge. After the campaign, you will pay for shipping separately through the pledge manager.
We estimate shipping a single copy of the book within the UK will cost around £10. Shipping a book to the US will be about £16. These costs may vary.

Please Note: Due to our fulfilment setup, items will ship from both the UK and the US in separate packages. This means certain rewards (like the main book) and add-ons (like the tiki mug) will originate from different locations, resulting in separate shipping charges. Some backers may be liable for import duties, taxes, and handling fees charged by their local customs authority on these packages. These fees are the backer's responsibility.

⚠️ IMPORTANT: Please note that activity on this campaign will be locked exactly one year after it concludes. As such, any backers who do not submit their shipping details survey by then will lose their claim to any campaign rewards, and their pledge will be treated as a donation to the campaign. This is because storing unclaimed items costs us additional taxes, insurance, and stock fees unaccounted for in the campaign. We will update and remind you about this regularly. Please check your spam folder regularly for our updates.
Thank you.
— Tim “Swanky” Glazner and the team at Korero

project.name: Ants & Crumbles: War At The Picnic Table
project.description: The Strategic Battle for Total Picnic Domination. Grow your colony, crush rivals and claim the picnic table!

creator.name: Fried Potatoes
creator.biography: We’re Thomas and Tibo, the creators behind Fried Potatoes Games, the company that brought Ants & Crumbles to life. We truly hope you’ll enjoy it as much as we enjoyed making it. Your support means the world to us and helps bring this game to tables everywhere. Thank you in advance for backing our project!

texte: ANTS & CRUMBLES started as a simple idea on a kitchen towel and evolved into our favorite game to play. Because we love this game so much, we created a special edition just for this Kickstarter. This exclusive version features a large holographic box, premium oversized components and Kickstarter only content.
The main game will be in English 🇬🇧. Online rulebooks will be available in German 🇩🇪, French 🇫🇷, Spanish 🇪🇸, Dutch 🇳🇱, and other requested languages.
In Ants & Crumbles there are multiple ways to win. Before diving into this Kickstarter, here is a quick overview of the game’s objectives.
In ANTS & CRUMBLES: WAR AT THE PICNIC TABLE, players take on the role of rival ant colonies, each marching across the picnic table in search of food and dominance
Watch our How to Play video below to see the game in action and learn the rules in minutes.

Want to see how a full game unfolds?
We’ve also recorded a uncut complete playthrough, showing real turns, tactics, and lively player interaction as the picnic table fills up. It’s perfect if you want a deeper feel for the flow, tension, and decision-making in Ants & Crumbles.
A big thank you to Het Spelletjeskoppel for playing Ants & Crumbles and sharing an online review! We’re genuinely proud of their feedback, and even more proud of the amazing score they gave us: a 9!

If you’d like to hear what they thought, you can read it here:

Het Spelletjeskoppel's Review - Ants & Crumbles: War at the Picnictable

We’ve created two expansions that build on ANTS & CRUMBLES in very different ways. One reimagines the battlefield, changing how the game feels from the ground up. The other layers seamlessly onto both versions, adding new risks and rewards without altering the core rules.

Together, they offer two different ways to expand the game, depending on how you want to play.

Battle in the Beehive is built on the same core gameplay as Ants & Crumbles, but the experience feels entirely different. With its new board and object system, it plays like a complete game in its own right rather than a simple expansion.

A Table Full of Perks & Hazards introduces a fresh layer of Perk and Hazard effects that sit on top of the existing gameplay. Designed to work seamlessly with both the Base Game and the Expansion, without changing the core rules.

Candy Tokens are dropped onto the board, tempting your ants with a sweet sugar boost they simply can’t resist. But every treat comes with a risk: these tokens can trigger powerful perks or nasty hazards.
If you’d like to dive deeper into how Ants & Crumbles plays, you can find the full rulebook for the main game, Ants & Crumbles: War at the Picnic Table, here.

We want ANTS & CRUMBLES to be the best possible game from day one.
Therefore, we decided not to keep gameplay elements or upgrades behind stretch goals. From the start, the game includes a premium box, a custom insert, and the complete gameplay experience, NO compromises.
That doesn’t mean we won’t celebrate success. If this campaign goes big, we’ve prepared 2 very special milestones!

We aim to move as quickly as possible while keeping production and fulfillment reliable and well controlled. This timeline is intentionally conservative to manage expectations and avoid disappointment.

We have solid experience producing and fulfilling board games and we work with trusted manufacturing and fulfillment partners we know well. Based on that experience, we do not anticipate any issues in production or delivery.
If we’re able to move faster at any stage, we’ll communicate updates clearly and make sure that momentum directly benefits our backers.
Just Two Brothers Making Games

We’re Thomas and Tibo, the brothers behind Fried Potatoes Games, the studio that brought Ants & Crumbles to life. This is our second Kickstarter, and this time we’re returning with a true Kickstarter exclusive edition.

The game started on a kitchen towel and evolved into Ants & Crumbles: War at the Picnic Table. We’ve poured our hearts into every detail, and we truly hope you’ll enjoy playing it as much as we enjoyed creating it.

Your support means the world to us and helps bring this game to tables around the globe. Thank you for backing our project.
Our goal is simple: to take the best possible care of our backers. We’ll do everything we can to ship rewards reliably, quickly, and at the lowest possible cost.

This is not our first Kickstarter. We have successfully fulfilled previous campaigns and we already handle worldwide fulfillment daily through our own webshop. We’re very familiar with international shipping, customs, and last mile delivery, and we’ll apply that experience fully to this project.
Our regular games are more compact, but even with the larger Kickstarter editions we’ll optimize packaging, routes, and fulfillment partners to keep costs down.
Once final quantities are confirmed, we’ll actively negotiate better shipping rates with our fulfillment and logistics partners. Any savings we achieve will, of course, be passed on to our backers.
To avoid any disappointment, we recommend assuming the higher end of the estimates below. If shipping ends up cheaper, you’ll benefit directly.

Based on our current estimates:
• Pledge 1 will cost approximately €20–30 to ship to the US and EU
• Regions outside the US and EU will be around €10 higher
• Pledge 2 is expected to be €5–15 more expensive than Pledge 1 due to increased size and weight
If you order multiple pledges, shipping costs will be lower per item. We will fully optimize this in the pledge manager to make sure combined shipping is applied correctly.

These are realistic estimates based on our existing fulfillment experience and current carrier rates. We’ll continue refining everything to make sure your reward arrives smoothly and without unnecessary costs.
z

Ants & Crumbles: Battle in the Beehive

options.name: Set of 96 Wooden Ant Tokens
options.desc: Extend your colony with an additional set of wooden ant tokens. Perfect for larger games, replacements, or simply having more ants at your command. Each colour comes neatly packed in its own matching storage box, similar to the classic army boxes found in modern Risk editions, keeping your picnic perfectly organised and battle‑ready.

options.name: Set of 4 Suede Token Bags
options.desc: Keep your ants neatly organised during gameplay with this set of four perfectly sized suede token bags. Each bag comfortably holds a full colony of wooden or acrylic ants and sits beautifully beside your player area, offering quick access as your line grows. Made from soft suede with embroidered detailing, these bags add both function and flair to your picnic table battles.

options.name: Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Expansion
options.desc:
You can now add extra copies of the Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Expansion Game to your pledge!

Because Kickstarter only allows one reward tier per pledge, this add-on makes it easy to order multiple expansions, perfect if you’re backing for friends, organising a group order, or want extra copies as gifts.

Each add-on includes the full Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Expansion Game, just like the one included in the higher reward tiers.

Add as many as you like!

options.name: Set of 96 Acrylic Ant Tokens
options.desc: Upgrade your colony with these aesthetically striking acrylic ant tokens. Durable, smooth, and visually stunning, they reflect light beautifully as your colony scuttles across the board, creating an ever‑shifting shimmer during play. Each set comes in a matching storage box, keeping your upgraded ants organised, safe, and ready for action.

options.name: Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Base Game
options.desc:
Want extra copies for friends, family, your game group… or your entire ant colony? 
Good news: you can now add additional Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Base Games to your pledge!

Kickstarter normally only allows one reward tier per pledge, so if you’d like to order multiple copies, this add-on is the easiest way to do it.

Each copy includes the full Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Base Game, exactly like the one in the reward tier.

project.name: Rubbit’s Car Wash in a Can - Fast & Accessible Car Wash
project.description: Clean your car in minutes with Rubbit's Car Wash In A Can™ - No hose, No mess.

creator.name: Rubbit
creator.biography: Rubbit is a company dedicated to creating eco-friendly car cleaning solutions that make car washing effortless, sustainable, and accessible for everyone. For the past 3 years, we’ve been creating advanced, innovative car care solutions that make maintaining a clean car easier and more effortless than ever.

titre: Safe For All Types Of Paint & Coating
texte: The Rubbit Foam was developed for waterless aircraft cleaning and adapted for powerful car care. Now available in a ready-to-use can, it makes car cleaning easy anywhere.

The Foam inside the Car Was In A Can™ surrounds and absorbs dirt, creating a slick barrier for safe, scratch-free cleaning with no water or rinsing required. ANYWHERE. Each can delivers countless quick touch-ups for a showroom shine, plus 2–3 full exterior, heavy-duty cleans for complete vehicle coverage - and is highly effective on bird droppings, tree sap, and more.

After our successful first Kickstarter campaign in 2023 - raising over $500,000 including post-campaign rewards - we delivered our products to thousands of backers and grew Rubbit into a fast-scaling brand, serving over 100,000 satisfied customers across 2024–2025 with our waterless car wash kits. By gathering feedback from customers using our proprietary Foam Formula and Foam Sprayer, we found ways to make the experience even faster, easier, and more affordable.
Now, we’re excited to introduce Rubbit’s Car Wash In A Can™ - powered by our proven Foam Formula and a more advanced, simplified application system for effortless, mess-free cleaning in minutes.

We are Raz & Shaked, two pilots turned entrepreneurs, alongside an amazing team: Hart, our VP of Marketing, Vikash, our VP of Product & Operations, and many more talented people. At the beginning of our journey, we recognized a problem in keeping small planes and helicopters clean safely and efficiently. Conventional water-pressure methods posed several challenges: they weren’t always available, and they created puddles in hangars that risked damaging the aircrafts’ electrical components.
We embarked on extensive research with chemists and a leading detergent factory, which led us to develop a revolutionary cleaning formula that, when applied with pressure, turns into a foam that absorbs dirt from the surface of the aircraft and can then be wiped away without rinsing. This was clearly a great solution for vehicles as well, so we gave it a try - and immediately realized its potential.
After succeeding with our car wash kits globally, serving over 100,000 customers in the past year, and following a very successful Kickstarter campaign, we decided to listen to our customers and take things one step further. The result is an even easier, faster, and more affordable solution - The Car Wash In A Can™.
A bit part of this Kickstarter campaign is to help us build our own production line and commit to mass production on U.S. soil!

The shipping rate will be provided after the campaign. Shipping within the U.S. is estimated at approximately $5–$8, depending on the size of the order and delivery location. You’ll be charged for shipping in the post-campaign survey. Please note that the item’s price does not include additional duties and taxes that may be applicable based on your local importation laws.
Return Policy: Kickstarter is a platform that enables innovators to offer their creations and ideas at discounted prices. By supporting our campaign, you contribute towards the production and launch of the product, ensuring you can enjoy it as per Kickstarter’s Terms of Use.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 3,500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $1B raised between them.

project.name: Ecoldbrew: Your Personal Automatic Cold Brew Machine
project.description: Fully Automatic Coffee Machine | 5-Minute Cold Brew | Grab-and-Go Convenience | Personalized Brew Settings | Compatible with Tumblers

creator.name: Ecoldbrew
creator.biography: Ecoldbrew redefines cold brew coffee, combining speed, quality, and convenience in one sleek, innovative machine. Experience the future of coffee now with Ecoldbrew!

titre: Turn the Dial, Brew Like a Pro
texte: Winner of the Best Kitchen Tech category at CES. Ecoldbrew is a smart, compact device that stores whole coffee beans, grinds them to theuser's preference, and draws water directly from a thermos to produce fresh cold brew on deman.
Ecoldbrew redefines cold brew coffee, combining speed, quality, and convenience in one sleek, innovative machine. Experience the future of coffee now with Ecoldbrew!

Forget overnight steeping and pre-ground beans: Ecoldbrew's integrated burr grinder pairs with patented centrifugal extraction technology to deliver the same rich, smooth taste of 12-hour cold brew in just 5 minutes. By grinding whole beans to optimal consistency and then optimizing water flow and fresh-ground saturation, it replicates the depth of traditional methods without the wait.

Compact yet powerful, Ecoldbrew fits effortlessly in car cup holders, backpacks, or office bags. Whether you're commuting, traveling, or enjoying the outdoors, enjoy barista-level cold brew anytime, anywhere and no electricity needed.

Use the precision control dial to adjust grind size with ease, while the touch LED panel on top presents step prompts, live status, and remaining time in a clear dashboard style layout. Guided interactions make every step smooth even for first timers. With the companion mobile app, each brew is automatically logged into extraction curves and flavor profiles by bean and taste.
Take control of your coffee experience. Adjust extraction time and spin speed to fine-tune your brew, whether you prefer a bold, intense concentrate or a lighter, smoother profile.

Each brew cycle delivers a generous 12oz serving, perfect for your daily caffeine fix. With a battery life supporting up to 8 full brews, Ecoldbrew keeps you fueled throughout the day without constant recharging.
The built-in water circulation system flushes out residue automatically, while the magnetic brewing chamber snaps off for quick rinsing. Spend less time cleaning and more time enjoying.
Two store-bought cold brews a day add up fast. Ecoldbrew pays for itself in weeks, delivering premium coffee at a fraction of coffee prices without sacrificing quality.
Designed to pair perfectly with Stanley 40oz Tumblers. The precision pour spout ensures drip-free transfer, keeping your gear and your commute clean.
Reduce waste without compromising convenience. By switching to Ecoldbrew, you'll save over 700 disposable cups annually, one delicious brew at a time.

Ecoldbrew was founded by a team of professionals with decades of combined experience in coffee equipment and smart home appliance development. Before starting this project, our team members had spent 10 to over 20 years working across coffee machine R&D, precision mechanics, fluid and motor control, and consumer electronics engineering.

Our background includes experience at global brands such as Xiaomi, Philips, De’Longhi, and Ningbo Borine, as well as professional coffee equipment manufacturers involved in the development and mass production of both home and commercial coffee machines. These experiences have taught us that in real-world use, stability, durability, consistency, and long-term reliability matter more than simply adding features.

During product development, we work closely with professional baristas as long-term advisors for testing and calibration. Coming from both specialty and commercial coffee systems, they help evaluate flavor, extraction performance, and impurity control to ensure each prototype reflects real usage scenarios.

On the manufacturing side, Ecoldbrew partners with Xinbao, one of the world’s largest coffee machine manufacturing groups, with over 20 years of experience serving internationally recognized coffee brands. This mature manufacturing system allows us to move forward with production-level engineering standards from day one, ensuring every Ecoldbrew machine is built on proven experience and reliable processes.

project.description: Multi-disciplinary artist Alteronce Gumby returns to journey the globe to capture nature’s breathtaking colors—from Iceland to Nigeria.

creator.name: Alteronce Gumby
creator.biography: Alteronce Gumby is a contemporary abstract painter and emerging filmmaker. His investigations center on the history of monochromatic painting, color theory, cosmology, astrophysics, interstellar photography and Impressionism.

texte: By John Campbell, Writer and Director

After much thought into what would be a great "next phase" of COLOR, I went away and researched places that would elevate the conversation of color, with “Nature” being the focus. Previously, we explored how color makes us feel through celebrations, traditions, and culture, like Holi in India and Mardi Gras in New Orleans; how we see color underwater in Australia at the Great Barrier Reef; color in food and spices, including the extraordinary one-color red sand between the Sahara Desert and Marrakech, Morocco; and the Northern Lights in Alaska.

COLOR in Nature explores color through natural climates, chemicals, and gases — through ice, trees, and soil — sharing the beauty of jungles, animals, fabrics, and dyes, manifesting its communication to us and its importance to all facets of this natural Earth.
By Alteronce Gumby, Creator and Producer

COLOR in Nature is a culmination of my lifelong passion for nature, exploration, and storytelling. Ever since I was a child, I've been enamored with the natural world, spending countless nights glued to the Discovery Channel, particularly captivated by shows like "Wild Discovery." This love for nature even led me to consider a career as a marine biologist at one point. During the filming of COLOR, I felt like I was living out a childhood dream, channeling the spirit of iconic naturalists like Steve Irwin or David Attenborough. Whether it was diving in the Great Barrier Reef, traversing the Sahara Desert, or witnessing the Northern Lights in Alaska, each moment was a testament to the wonder and beauty of our planet.

In 2023, my journey took a deeper perspective during an ayahuasca retreat, which heightened my awareness of my connection to nature and the universe. This newfound perspective has fueled my desire to delve even further into the mysteries of the natural world through COLOR in Nature. Living in New York City has undoubtedly created a sense of disconnect from nature, despite the presence of places like Central Park. Through this documentary, I aim to reconnect with the essence of nature and explore its vibrant colors in diverse landscapes. These include the glaciers of Iceland; the Rainbow Mountains of Cusco, Peru; the jungles of Hang Pygmy, Vietnam; the Mona Monkeys and Dye Pits of Nigeria; and the butterfly sanctuaries of Piedra Herrada, Mexico — all paired with an "insightful" conversation about how we actually see COLOR.
Inspired by this entire experience, all caught on camera, I was later inspired to make work that connects to each location, celebrating and closing an unforgettable journey into nature.

COLOR in Nature is not just about exploration; it's about rediscovering our place within the intricate web of life on Earth. As an artist explorer, I see it as my calling to seek out these foreign yet inherently natural patterns that exist in the world, sharing their beauty and significance with others. This moment in my life feels ripe for such an adventure, and I'm eager to embark on this journey of discovery.

John Campbell (right) is founder of multi award winning creative production and management co., JCINTIME,LLC sharing cultural and creative stories and messages through feature film, documentaries, and episodics with global film and TV studios and networks. Learn more.

Alteronce Gumby (left) is a contemporary abstract painter and emerging filmmaker. His investigations center on the history of monochromatic painting, color theory, cosmology, astrophysics, interstellar photography and Impressionism. Learn more.

project.name: Dungeon, Inc.
project.description: A reverse dungeon TTRPG by the Merry Mushmen

creator.name: Olivier Revenu
creator.biography: Olivier Revenu is a game designer, publisher, kamikaze paraglider and horse rider, and gamer since 1981. When not publishing nerdy mags, he is an independent graphic designer and lives in the basque country, the best part of the known world.

titre: Just enough lore to get you going
We are all a big family at Dungeon, Inc.
texte:
Delve dungeons, slay adventurers, collect your paycheck. 
Dungeon, Inc. is an old-school style, reverse-dungeon game set within a corporate megadungeon. This campaign is for the new edition of award-winning French TTRPG Donjon & Cie (2022), remastered and augmented by the Merry Mushmen with its original author, Ben Felten.

Dungeon, Inc. the game is about monsters working for Dungeon, Inc., a corporate organisation secretly running the largest megadungeon in the land. The players are Reception hosts, tasked with solving ‘client issues’, mostly adventurers refusing to die. They are employed by the company secretly operating inside the most famous dungeon in all the land. Each mission sends the hosts into a dungeon level, generally to 'deal' with clients. The organization relies on looting adventurers for income, but some must escape with enough loot to spread the Dungeon’s legend and attract more clients. Of course, no one can ever know that the Dungeon is a deadly tourist trap!
Missions are followed by a downtime period where players get to have an office life. They relax, spend their little disposable income (or the loot they ‘forgot’ to hand over), pursue friendships and romantic aspirations, and perhaps investigate the dark deals and inhumane machinations of upper management.
A typical Dungeon, Inc. campaign starts with a simple mission, but as the hosts gain experience, they become involved in lethal office politics and magic power struggles that lead them to discover some of the company’s many secrets. What starts as a dungeon of the week episodic series can end up in an epic saga where more than mere survival is at stake! The characters may even have to venture in the Bright Outside, the dreaded world of the surface where danger is everywhere (at least that’s what the company keeps saying).

Dungeon, Inc. is a 128-page hardback, A5 book (close to digest-size). It contains everything you need for a complete campaign: rules for character creation, fast and battlemap-free combat, powerful but life-draining magic, and everything else you would expect from a fantasy game. The company’s structure and organization are explained in enough detail to help the DM (Discussion Moderator, we know that other term is trademarked!) and players fill in the blanks. Many random tables will help them flesh out clients (adventurers), colleagues (monsters), dungeon denizens (also monsters), office rumors and interactions, mission complications, and much more. Chapters devoted to mission creation and campaign modes assist planner DMs as well as the seat-of-your-pants improv types.
The Mission Booklet is a 72-page softcover A5 book. It contains no less than 10 missions for all seniority ranks (as we call experience levels), from the simple ‘find the invisible halfling’ job to the company-shattering clusterfuck that will require masterful politicking to just survive.

At Mushmen Tower, we don’t believe in tomes full of histories, room-by-room inventories, and long lists of NPCs. This is one of the things we love about the original Donjon & Cie. Ben came up with just the right amount of material to start a campaign. At character creation, the table comes up with a handful of NPCs: the team’s close collaborators, as well as their best frenemy – the employee of the month – and give every character a relationship with them. From there, the DM can rely on easy-to-use descriptions for each Department and Section of the Dungeon to flesh out relationships, create situations, and roll up the NPCs they need. They will of course be able to build on the 10 adventures from the Mission Booklet to start their campaign.

These books aren’t filled with self-referential jokes. At its core, the game is a rather gritty dungeon delver with twists – how many dungeons have you explored with a map that marks all the traps… Wait, was this map updated after the renovations? Anyway, we promise you will laugh a lot playing Dungeon, Inc. But the humour derives from the game’s proposition – delving a dangerous dungeon as underpaid troubleshooters. This alone makes a lot of things funny in their absurdity. Situations that are difficult, annoying, or even deadly for characters become hilarious to us players. Like any good parody, Dungeon, Inc. builds on clichés and genre twists to create a loving homage to the original roleplaying game and dungeon-delving fantasy. It is a great game for the episodic one-shot, but after a few sessions everyone will want to know more about their colleagues, managers, and whatever threat was hinted at during the last mission.

Dungeon, Inc. is built onto Macchiato Monsters, itself a hack of OSR powerhouses Whitehack and The Black Hack (both homages to the classic editions of D&D). To get technical, it is a streamlined d20 roll-under system that takes advantage of the risk die mechanic (derived from TBH’s usage die) to abstract resources and handle threats in a fun way. From Whitehack, it borrows the freeform nature of magic and expands its classless open character creation. In Dungeon, Inc. you can play any monster you want, with any combination of special abilities. You even get to come up with your own spells! As most old-school inspired games, Dungeon, Inc. is for players who enjoy a challenge. Reception hosts are often in over their heads: not only do they have to defeat seasoned adventurers who slay ogres for breakfast, but they must avoid traps, manage dungeon denizens, and other mission surprises while keeping the existence of the company a secret. Bloodthirsty hack-and-slashers will enjoy short careers while out-of-the box thinkers are the one who will get to retire. Maybe. One day... if they can stay clear of their Termination colleagues.

Dungeon, Inc. was years in the making (plus another handful of years of development for this current version) and it is the product of many influences, but pop culture touchstones include: Bullfrog’s video game Dungeon Keeper, Sfar & Trondheim’s long-running graphic novel series Donjon, the TV show The Office, the masterful manga Delicious in Dungeon by Kui Ryōko, the classic Pixar movie Monsters, Inc., and  the TTRPG Paranoia by West End Games.

For years, the Old-School Renaissance movement has attracted enthusiasts of all ages with its rulings-over-rules philosophy and open-world adventures. But giving total freedom to a group of TTRPG nerds is intimidating. With its mission-based framework, Dungeon, Inc. is ideal for the group who wants to dip a toe in the rewarding waters of the OSR before jumping headfirst. As the DM, you decide which mission to drop on your players, watch them make a mess in this closed environment, and let them roam freely in the office sandbox, where they will find allies and make enemies. You and your friends can progressively learn to handle a rules-light, freedom heavy TTRPG, and before you know it, everyone will be ready to overthrow Mr. Noir, the enigmatic Overseer-in-Chief and funder of Dungeon, Inc.

Overt two years ago (yeah, that's how long we've been working on this game), we made a quickstart zine containing a summary of the rules and a 'first job'adventure, along with five pregenerated Reception hosts. Some minor rules changes have occured since then, and the layout its completely different, but if you're curious, you can download it from the ressources page of the TMM website.

We are handling fulfilment directly ourselves from France as we can take advantage of the subsidised letter rates for books. We get tracking numbers but these aren’t communicated digitally, so we will not be able to automatically share your tracking numbers to you. For the USA, we work with a trusted partner who takes care of fulfilment from the East Coast, which explains the different shipping fee for Unites States addresses.

We’re a boutique RPG publisher with very artisanal inner workings. There is no time or brainpower for complicated crowdfunding campaigns including boxes, dice, cloth maps, and the like. Don’t get us wrong, we love buying all the shiny things from more adept crews than ours. We also don’t like promising extra content to create hype. These things take time to do, delay us when something goes south, while all we want is make the next cool book. So we stick to making books. The good news is, we are done with the game, so we will be able to fulfil the digital books right after the campaign ends.

Editorial Committee: Ben Felten, Edwin Nagy, Tom McGrenery, The Merry Mushmen (Olivier and Eric)
Board of Art Awesomeness: Carlos Castilho, Jacob Fleming, Jérôme Huguenin, Kennon James, Keny Widjaja, Laetitia ‘Nydenlafée’ Combe, Lucas Korte, Marc Moureau, Peter Mullen, Thierry Ségur, Yuri Perkowski

comments.text: Hello, I didn't see mention of this on the campaign page - what's the print quality of the books?

replies.text: Henri, there are two books. The rulebook is hardcover, sewn. The mission booklet it softcover saddle-stitched. There is no case (that would have made costs skyrocket...)

comments.text: We are so excited by this project!!

replies.text: So are we !!! Thanks for mentioning it, warms our little mushy hearts.

comments.text: Will there be a GM screen like you had in Donjon cie?

replies.text: Christopher, there will not be a GM screen as part of the kickstarter. I suppose if people scream and clamour for one down the line, we might look into it ;-)

comments.text: If there is time and budget, may we have stickers please?

replies.text: We have no plans in this area at this stage, but we'll think about it if there's demand in the future.

comments.text: Quick question on combat, does the pesky client roll for attack, or do our beloved Monsters just roll their respective statt to defend?

replies.text: Thanks for your question, Christopher. Dungeon, Inc.'s system is based on Macchiato Monsters, so like in MM (and in Black Sword Hack) only the players roll to succeed. For each turn of combat the players get to roll and the adversaries (often clients) act/react either when the PCs fail or when the PCs do not engage with them. So not a single roll per combat either.
ah yes, I ment combat turns.

Not at my table (and I have run the game a lot, as you can imagine). First of all, with a straight 3D6 roll for stats, you don't get 18s that often. Second, disadvantages and bad tactical positioning can still threaten you (for example, an adversary that had multiple attacks if you only have one, or a bowman you can't reach, or multiple opponents, and you'll still get hit even if you succeed on your rolls). But I guess the most relevant answer is that while the hosts' orders are to kill the clients, direct confrontation if often not the best way to achieve that...

project.name: The Kazi: Village Rescue - Afrofuturist Animated Short Film
project.description: The Kazi: Village Rescue is a Caribbean animated short-film about a young boy who must save a village from a menacing enemy threat.

creator.name: Alex-Andre Bassett
creator.biography: Alex-André Bassett is a Bermudian-Canadian Writer/Director whose work is deeply shaped by the island’s culture and storytelling traditions. Since moving to Vancouver, he has continued developing his craft through acting, screenwriting and directing programs. Alex’s work aims to share his imagination and island heritage with global audiences.

titre: Back the film. Protect the village. Join the legend. 🌍 Why This Story Matters 🎬 Funding Breakdown 🎥 The Animation Team Making This 🎁 Backer Rewards You'll Love 🎯 Stretch Goals 🔥 What You're Backing ❤️ This Is A Call To The Believers
texte:
What if the next legendary animated hero didn’t come from a massive studio…
…but from a tiny island with a huge imagination?
What if YOU could help bring that legend to life?

Welcome to The Kazi: Village Rescue — a wildly adventurous, heart-pounding animated short film created to celebrate island bravery, community spirit, and the magic that happens when ordinary kids become unexpected heroes.

And today…
I’m asking you to help me make history.

Growing up on the small island of Bermuda, (with only 65,000 people), I dreamed of seeing characters on screen who looked like us, sounded like us, moved through worlds inspired by our rhythms, our humor, our courage, and our culture.
But those stories rarely existed.
So I decided to build one.

Village Rescue follows a fearless young hero, named Andreas, who must rescue a village from a mysterious threat using nothing but wit, determination, heart and the help of an unexpected sidekick.
It’s fun.
It’s cinematic.
It’s meaningful.
And it’s the kind of film that shows kids everywhere — especially from small, overlooked communities — that their stories are worthy of the spotlight too.

This isn’t just animation.
It’s representation in motion.

Animation is magical…
…but it’s also expensive. Good quality animation typically starts at around $10,000/minute.
The $30,000 will create a 3-minute animated short film and the funds will be going towards the following areas:

To bring this film to life with the quality it deserves — vibrant character designs, stunning backgrounds, immersive sound, and professional animation — I need the support of people who believe in this vision.
People who believe island stories are global stories.
People like you.

Your pledge doesn’t just fund a film.
It unlocks a world.

Nani Moco Studios in Vancouver, BC has been selected as the animation studio to complete the animation production of the short film. They are an award-winning studio that has over 20 years of combined experience working on Disney and Netflix animated shows. They have already completed proof-of-concept animation of the main character Andreas in the past and are excited to build out the world of The Kazi even more!
Founders of Nani Moco Studios - Kendal & Mark

From exclusive art books and posters…
to personal thanks from the director…
to limited edition merch…                                                                                                   AND even a super-rare Andreas figurine...
There’s something incredible waiting for you on the other side of that “Back This Project” button.
Goal 1: $10,000 USD – this is the minimum needed to continue the short film project
Goal 2: $20,000 USD – we will complete voice acting, character rigs and backgrounds
Goal 3: $30,000 USD – funds needed to complete total short film production!
Goal 4: $50,000 USD – Begin development of the first short episode to continue the Village Rescue story arc, including one research trip to West Caribbean for concept art and world building workshops
Goal 5: $70,000 USD – Produce first short episode in Village Rescue story arc!
By supporting this project, you’re directly helping create:

✨ A hero kids can root for
✨ A film rooted in island identity and cultural pride
✨ A project by Loquat Films dedicated to elevating underrepresented voices
✨ A spark that could ignite a whole new wave of Caribbean and island animation

Every dollar goes into the production:
art, animation, music, voices, studio time, and the team needed to make this world explode with life.

If you’ve ever watched a film and wished the heroes looked a little more like you…
If you’ve ever dreamed of being part of a creative movement…
If you love animation, island stories, or underdog victories…

Then this project is yours.
Back it. Share it. Join it.
Let’s create something the world has never seen — together.
👉 Back the Kickstarter now and become part of the legend of The Kazi.

project.name: DEVIL GRACE 4
project.description: Dark fantasy comedy comic for adult readers. NSFW content inside.

creator.name: MarkMan
creator.biography:
My name is Marek. First of all I'm a big fan of  vikings and Norse mythology.
One of my main goals was to create a comic book so that everyone, during and after reading the INCREDIBLE NORSE MYTHS AND LEGENDS series, would not only have a good time but also had learned a lot and could confidently say that they know Scandinavian mythology well.

texte: This campaign will run for only 20 days — shorter than previous editions, which lasted 30 days. This decision allows for a more focused, dynamic campaign and better communication throughout its duration.
If you were planning to support the project later — this time, don’t leave it until the last minute.
Let me tell you this myself — because who could do it better than me?

This is already the fourth chapter of my earthly adventures. DEVIL GRACE 4. And trust me: if you thought it was hot before… that was just the warm-up. This time it’s sharper, more shameless, and decidedly more hellish.

In SHE-DEVIL DOESN’T WEAR PRADDA, I take everything you love about this series and push it to the breaking point: cheeky humor, my devilish sex appeal, absurd situations, and me — once again doing exactly what you’re notsupposed to do on Earth… but very much want to.
It’s going to be bold. It’s going to be indecent. It’s going to be very, very hot. And if anyone ever told you that she-devils should behave themselves — they definitely weren’t talking about me.

Issue four opens with a dream. The dream of one of the demons sent to Earth to hunt me down. But have you ever wondered… do demons even dream at all?
And if they do — what about?

You’ll have to take my word for it — at least until you hold your own copy in your hands — that the finale of this dream, and the brutal awakening into real, earthly reality, will turn that dream upside down. But it’s far too explicit to be shown on Kickstarter.

Driven by my purely hellish curiosity, I decided to drop by the PRADDA boutique.
After all, I’d always heard that this is where my father gets his clothes.
And if he wears them… I really wanted to see what I’d find there — and whether I’d look just as stiff in them myself.

And that’s when the surprise was waiting for me.
Right there, inside the boutique, I came face to face with my godfather… God himself.
At that point, it was perfectly clear this was definitely not going to be an ordinary shopping trip.

And what will come of that meeting? And will God manage to convince me to return to Hell?
You’ll have to find out for yourselves.

As if that weren’t enough, my greatest enemy also shows up — Mammon.
The problem is, it doesn’t take him long to realize he’s landed in the worst possible place, at the worst possible time.

In this issue, I also tracked down three demons sent to Earth to hunt me down.
The problem is, instead of chasing me… those losers were hiding from the entire world in a landfill.
All it took was a bit of motivation, a touch of hellish character correction, and suddenly I had three smooth-talking, devilishly effective bodyguards that are very hard to take your eyes off.
Which, of course, didn’t escape the attention of jealous and pathologically possessive Death — because my little makeover of those idiots drove her absolutely insane.

In this issue, you’ll also meet Olga and Adam — a couple madly in love with each other.
And then I show up… and make them a certain immoral proposal.
Or rather — they simply have the misfortune of crossing my path.
After a long and rather heated argument, Adam and Olga — clearly reluctant, but in the end convinced — finally agree to my proposal and arrive together at my apartment.

But that’s only the beginning of my perfidious plan.
Hidden behind a one-way mirror, Olga watches every single detail of what unfolds in the adjoining room.
And me? I know exactly what I’m doing.
I can’t show you anything beyond this point — because the following pages are far too explicit and uncensored for such a well-behaved place as Kickstarter.
But trust me… exactly what you’re imagining happens there.
The fourth part of the series The Earthly Adventures of Devil Grace: She-Devil Doesn’t Wear Prada

33-page comic book printed on glossy 170 gsm paper.
Each copy will be individually packed in a resealable plastic sleeve.
Orders will be shipped in protective cardboard envelopes.
CREATIVE TEAM

Marek Mandziński – story creator, writer, letterer, editor
Cristian Karlen – penciller and inker
M. R. Kumar – colorist

In the first part, you’ll meet a young, rebellious she-devil named Grace — the daughter of Satan himself. Bored with the monotony of Hell, Grace is infamous for her defiant and often erotic antics, which throw the underworld into chaos and push her father’s patience to the limit. Although Satan has big, ambitious plans for her, Grace follows her own desires, which don’t align with Hell’s strict rules.

When she’s punished by being sent to Heaven, Grace makes a bold decision to escape to Earth. There, she transforms into a beautiful, seductive woman and begins a life full of erotic adventures in the human world. Alongside her is Death — a small, sarcastic demoness who watches Grace’s wild ideas unfold with growing dread and does her best to keep them in check.

In the second part of this extraordinary comic book series, Grace dives even deeper into the world of humans — and their temptations. The red-haired daughter of Satan explores the pleasures of the flesh, growing closer to a young waitress named Klara, with whom she uncovers the sensual secrets of earthly life.

Hot on her trail are three rather dim-witted hunters, sent by Satan himself. The very same ones Grace shamelessly manipulated in the first part for her own wicked plans — convincing them that erotic toys were modern torture devices. Now they must face the harsh reality of life on Earth, which turns out to be far more brutal than the deepest pits of Hell.

At the start, we follow Grace and Klara, who dive deeper into the world of desire and pleasure. Klara – once shy and uncertain – is being transformed under Grace’s fiery guidance into a woman fully aware of her power and lusts.

Their relationship grows bolder, filled with dominance, playful provocations, and raw passion. Always at their side is Death, the sarcastic miniature reaper, whose biting remarks balance the tension with sharp, irreverent humor.

But the story soon escalates. In Hell, fury is brewing – Satan has discovered that Grace slipped from his grasp and now demands her return. Unaware of the betrayal secretly being plotted against him by Mammon and his father Behemoth, Satan unleashes Mammon – the son of Behemoth, a demon of greed and manipulation who bends human desires as easily as he once bent global financial markets. His mission is clear: to capture Grace and drag her back to Hell.

On Earth, it is Little Death who first stumbles upon Mammon by chance. Usually carefree and mischievous, this time she froze in terror – for she recognized in the newcomer none other than the son of Behemoth. Though accidental, this encounter foretells that nothing will unfold in an ordinary way anymore.
